intro: Diplopterys longialata, commonly known as the Amazonian angel's trumpet, is a striking tropical plant native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its large, pendulous flowers that resemble trumpets, typically ranging in color from yellow to orange. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic species, and it contains various alkaloids in its leaves and flowers. Its foliage is thick and waxy, adapted to thrive in high humidity and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
